question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Pay attention to ensure that the generated code is executable for demonstration.

Please help me implement the following requirements using code. Create a black and white illustration of a smartphone with speech bubbles emerging from it, using SVG code.

checklist.title: Is the basic smartphone structure properly implemented in SVG?
checklist.description: Check if the smartphone outline includes key components (body, screen, home button, camera) with proper proportions and positioning. The smartphone should be clearly recognizable as such. Score 0 if the basic structure is missing, 5 if only a simplified outline is provided, and 10 if all key components are well-implemented with proper SVG path elements and grouping.

checklist.title: Are the speech bubbles correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether multiple speech bubbles are created with proper bubble shapes (including the pointer/tail directed towards the smartphone). Check for proper use of <path> elements or combined shapes for smooth curves. Score 3 points for basic rectangular bubbles, 7 points for properly curved bubbles, and 10 points if bubbles have varied shapes/sizes with proper pointers pointing to the smartphone.

checklist.title: Is the black and white color scheme properly applied?
checklist.description: Verify that the illustration strictly uses only black, white, and grayscale values without any color. Check proper use of 'fill', 'stroke', and opacity attributes to create depth and contrast. Deduct 3 points for each color usage, and 5 points if contrast is insufficient to distinguish elements clearly. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG code well-structured with proper element hierarchy?
checklist.description: Examine the organization of SVG elements with appropriate grouping (<g> tags), logical naming of elements with 'id' or 'class' attributes, and proper nesting. Check if related elements are grouped together (phone components, speech bubbles). Deduct 5 points for flat structure without grouping, 3 points for inconsistent naming conventions. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code uses proper viewport settings, responsive design techniques (viewBox, preserveAspectRatio), and can adapt to different container sizes without distortion. Check if the illustration maintains proper appearance across different browsers. Code with strong robustness should handle these considerations effectively, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if these considerations are ignored, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the illustration (e.g., 1. Subtle animations for speech bubbles 2. Interactive elements that respond to hover/click 3. Creative use of gradients or patterns within the black and white constraint). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Unnecessarily complex paths that could be simplified 2. Duplicate definitions of similar elements 3. Excessive detail that doesn't contribute to the overall illustration. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core illustration is obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization (meaningful comments, proper indentation), optimization (use of symbols for repeated elements, minimal path points), and best practices (proper namespace usage, appropriate attribute ordering). Deduct 5 points if paths are overly verbose; deduct 5 points if there's significant redundancy in definitions; deduct 5 points if the file size is unnecessarily large due to poor optimization. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the illustration meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows professional illustration principles: 1) Balanced composition with proper visual weight 2) Consistent line weights and styling 3) Good use of negative space and proportion. Deduct 3 points for unbalanced composition, 5 points for inconsistent styling elements, and 5 points for poor use of space that creates visual confusion. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG accessible and semantically correct?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG includes appropriate accessibility features: 1) Proper title and description elements 2) ARIA attributes where appropriate 3) Text elements using actual <text> elements rather than paths when containing readable content. Deduct 4 points for missing title/description, 3 points for inaccessible text content, and 3 points for lack of semantic structure. The full score is 10 points.
